name: Hilton San Diego Gaslamp Quarter

reviews.text: Stayed in the "5th Avenue Loft Building", which was adjacent to the main building through the Terrace level. Although it took a while to find the room through the many passageways, the signage was adequate. The loft building features many unique room shapes, which are accessed through a sigle elevator off of the "The Terrace" which is a large outdoor seating patio area. The rooms from the loft buildings are accessed through partially outdoor hallways which then lead to indoor hallways for the remainder of the long walk to the room.
reviews.title: What a great property

reviews.text: The room was loft like, with large windows and very high ceilings, I would say around 14 feet or so. My room overlooked the Hard Rock hotel and the main entry arch for the Gas Lamp District. The convention center is across the street and the light rail (Orange Line) is directly in front of the hotel. I had no issues with noise or train horns blowing as other readers have commented on.
reviews.title: Unique for a Hilton

reviews.text: The room was attractive. There was one king berd, a chair, desk, and avery large flat screen television. What was a shock was the FREE in-room Internet. Now we're talking. It's about time large chains started offering what small chains have been doing for years, although I feel this property is unique within the Hilton brand.
reviews.title: Parking is $35! Yes that's righ....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lighting in the room was pleasant and offered many choices, including pot lights on a dimmer above the bed. The bathroom also featured pot lights that were controlled by a dimmer.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, nice location, lackluster service

reviews.text: The bathroom was larger than any other I have seen in a standard hotel room. This would appear to be the trend moving forward as clients are demanding larger and larger bathrooms than in the past. This place delivers to those who demand large washrooms. The floor, although tiled, was never cold.
reviews.title: Just don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolute worst Hilton I've stayed in. They don't have proper security around the hotel. If you do decide to stay there take ALL your personal belongings with you, because your belongings will be missing upon your return to the room. Ontop of stealing, they wont reimburse you for your loss. Thats not it, no point giving your car to valet because they dont take proper care of it. My car ( Acura TL) was returned with dirt stains on the trunk. It was parked under a cieling leak, and when i asked the valet why it was parked there? he shrugged his shoulders and didnt give a care in the world nor offered to clean it. Honestly the worst experience ever! I've stayed at other Hiltons, this one is by far the worst.
reviews.title: Theft in Hotel

reviews.text: We got the Hilton Gaslamp Quarter through Priceline. The hotel is very attractive, furnished in 20th century mid century modern. The room was large, but the bathroom quite small. There is a stress on being green with low flushing Toto toilets, and motion sensitive bathroom lights. We had to call to find out how to turn the bathroom light off. We couldn't! it was a set to go off in 11 minutes. The hotel is right across the street from the convention center and our room looked over the center and the train tracks. With the help of a sound spa for white noise, we did not hear the train, and slept well. It is nice that the windows open. Bedside lamps are tall and I had to get out of bed to turn it off. We found a parking lot around the corner which charged $10 for 24 hours as opposed to the valet parking at the hotel. The internet was on the slow side, but free for Hilton Gold card members. We had a very nice breakfast at the Broken Yolk, right around the corner. We could walk to many attractions. Nice location, and a nice hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location. The property is at the entrance of the Gaslamp district. There are a few bars/lounges nearby but the hotel is a few blocks from most bars/lounges which I actually preferred (less noise & foot traffic). There are several great restaurants a few feet from the hotel but beware; many close at midnight. I recommend the Strip Club (1 block over). Crazy name but it's a good steakhouse, nice atmosphere & the experience of grilling your own steak was fun.
reviews.title: Great Location - Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in a king room in the Lofts portion of the hotel. Nice room albeit small. For those light sleepers in the Loft I suggest staying in a room that has a window facing the terrace (rather than K Street). My room faced the street and there was some noise from a terrace party at the Hard Rock across the street. The noise wasn't overbearing but might cause difficulty for some. There's a nice trail in front of the hotel for a nice morning jog.
reviews.title: Sorry to say this hotel stinks, literally.

reviews.text: Pleasant staff. Concierge was helpful. Parking is expensive ($35/night) but given the area it might be standard. I received breakfast vouchers & it was a pleasant surprise. Also, it's a full breakfast; not just continental.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, but you can't avoid the NOISY train!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a quick weekend getaway. We have stayed in all the other Hilton hotels in downtown San Diego, so we eager to give the Gaslamp Hilton a try. We were'nt disappointed!
reviews.title: Great alternative to large, impersonal chain hotels in San Diego!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is more of a boutique-style hotel, rather than a huge, sterile chain hotel. I'm sure it's a newer building, but appears to be an older facade that fits well into the historic Gaslamp District. We had a room in the 5th Ave. Lofts. This was a separate building - we had to take the elevator from the main lobby up one floor, walk through an attractive outside "terrace", into a separate building. This building looks like a converted warehouse or factory, but again, I'm pretty sure it's a newer building. The remote location of our room was well worth it - but if you value convenience more than a unique location, ask for a room in the main building.
reviews.title: Superb convention location-but don't stay in The Loft rooms

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a whirlpool suite, which was beautiful. It was really one huge room, with a sitting area, 42" or so TV, and very comfortable king size bed. The ceilings were high and one wall was windows looking out over the activity on 5th Street, the main entrance to the Gaslamp District. The whirlpool tub was in the bathroom dressing area, but there was a shuttered "window" that opened to the main room. It was plenty big for two and very relaxing!
reviews.title: The worst Hilton experience of my life

reviews.text: There's a park-like walkway adjacent to the hotel. It's a relatively short walk to Seaport Village and the other waterfront attractions.
reviews.title: A great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a city hotel. You'll hear noise from the street and the adjacent train tracks. But that's a price I'm more than willing to pay to be in the center of the action. No need to take your car anywhere - it's all within walking distance!
reviews.title: Excellent, clean, well-managed property

reviews.text: I'm very satisfied with this hotel. I usually don't like to stay in Hilton hotels but this one looks like it's either brand new or newly renovated. It reminds me of a small boutique style hotel. The rooms are average sized but are very comfortable and are well decorated in a modern theme. There was a huge HDTV in room as well. But most importantly, internet is FREE in the lobby and even in the rooms. This is hard to find because most hotels charge for in-room internet.
reviews.title: Well kept, modern hotel

reviews.text: The location is great. Right in the Gaslamp District just a quick walk up the street to all the bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Modern Hilton - decent rooms, well located, nicely appointed

reviews.text: I found street parking which saved me a lot because the hotel charges $35 per night for parking.
reviews.title: Is it really necessary for the train conductor to blow its whistle 10 times at 2 a.m.?
Great View
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again.

Rooms are nice, beds are great, no complaints. I sleep well, but did note the train engineer's attempt to alter my experience (multiple horn blasts at 2am, but hey, I am on East Coast time, so 2am here is coffee time in DC....). Bathroom is nice, but has a motion sensor on the lighting which actually shut off a couple of times while I was in the shower. I am as "green as the next guy", but the auto shut off light, combined with a closer on the bathroom door meant showering in the pitch dark. For the less adventurous soul it might have been dangerous. Combination of price, location, decor, great breakfast location makes this a great value and nice place to stay. Hilton is a superior brand. Don't take my comments as negative. I am not picky. This is a good value in a very modern room. A very comfortable stay. Staff was courteous and professional. Room is spotless. Hoping the hotel reads this: the fitness center could use some TLC (TV on elliptical is not functional, headsets not cleaned, stocked, no clock in fitness room, check overall cleanliness in fitness center). Again,small things. I like this hotel.
reviews.title: I'd stay here again

reviews.text: We got a pretty amazing deal on Priceline for our double queen room of $89 + tax / fees for our one night stay, and were very pleased.
reviews.title: Quick, enjoyable stay

reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze, and the lobby of the hotel is quite elegant.
reviews.title: Great location! Minor flaws

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was very nice, but did smell a tiny bit of stale cigarette smoke, (however not enough for us to complain about.) Our room faced the back of the building - we could still hear the train, but it was not disruptive. The color scheme of the room / furniture was all very warm and inviting, the beds were very comfortable, and we heard nary a peep from other hotel guests which goes a long way towards happiness in my book.
reviews.title: Wonderful Anniversary at the Gaslamp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only (minor) gripe is about the parking situation. The valet is $35 a day, which seems a bit high, and there didn't seem to be any other options but granted, we didn't try terribly hard to find alternate parking.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights, purchased through priceline.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location for Gaslamp & Cruise Port

reviews.text: We were pleased with pretty much everything. Short taxi ride from airport and cruise port. Perfect for gaslamp if thats your destination.
reviews.title: a conventioneer's dream"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are trains that go by, don't let that suprise you!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the money, and I emphasize that fact only; you can do much better in San Diego's fabled Gas Lamp District. Located conveniently across the street from the SDCC, this hotel is a short walk to comfortable hotel rooms (beds), a smoking Oasis, friendly bartenders (and head-chef), and Fox News playing in the Lobby at all hours (unless you wrangle the remote from the staff - and they will relinquish it easily!) . I did not like the bathrooms in this hotel: I had to clean my bathtub with Chlorox and the narrow tub's pitch, is uncomfortable for showerers. The bathroom door is auto-close, and the light is motion sensored. And you cannot turn it off!
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Service

reviews.text: The meeting rooms are accommodating – but the chairs are not comfortable. Internet is available, but we’ve still not found a hotel that gets is – yet – without many phone calls and a lot of extra conversation. Since you have to get up and walk, often – it’s nice to have a lovely historic “patio” to escape to. Comfy outdoor couches for the consistent SD temperatures make the uncomfortable meeting room chairs bearable!
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Hotwire Price, Great Service, many 'little' charges added up.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow, AFTER booking the hotel room on "your guess is as good as mine" Priceline, we found out that the hotel charges a whopping $35 PER DAY for parking. The only parking here is valet so they think they can get away with that. I understand how valet parking works, but to have it as the only option is wrong.
reviews.title: $35 MANDATORY Parking Fee, Are you kidding me?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shame on Hilton for only having mandatory $35 + Tip valet parking, and shame on Priceline for not disclosing that or including it in the price and then saying "Sorry man, you've already booked". I'm filing a report with the BBB.
reviews.title: Great Priceline Win!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's true what people say about the loud trains, rude staff, and un-caring help.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel in Gaslamp!

reviews.text: Really, save yourself the headache.
reviews.title: One of the Best Hilton's in USA - HH Diamond Member

reviews.text: Got this for about $75 on Priceline and we were quite pleased with the win. The room was great -- on the tenth floor with nice views of the city. Were treated to some fireworks a bit after we checked in! Bed was super comfortable, free internet hook-up, room was spotless.
reviews.title: Fabulous and Romantic!!

reviews.text: Visited on Father's Day weekend with spouse and children (10 & 12 yrs). The location was convenient but noisy with the train passing through. The rooms were smaller than I expected but overall the hotel was well maintained. The mandatory valet parking was expensive. For the price I paid at Hotwire - I would visit again but not if I had to pay full price.
reviews.title: Nice upscale hotel but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent my 30th birthday in San Diego, and I did countless hours of research trying to decide on the best hotel. We finally went with the Hilton Gas Lamp, because we got a great deal on Hotwire. This is a basic hotel, its nice, very convenient location. We didn't have any train noise. We enjoyed the rooftop pool, it was nicely appointed. And the beds were incredibly comfy. I am seriously considering buy the bed from Hilton. It was fabulous! And one night we bought some wine at a CVS, and brought it back. But unfortunately left home without a corkscrew, and the bartender gave us one. It was really nice of him!
reviews.title: Conveniently located, got a great deal on Hotwire.

reviews.text: I have a love-hate relationship with this hotel. I got there at about 9pm, when I arrived I had to valet park the car, which is $35.00 a night. I went to the front desk to check in and they said they were full. I had made a reservation about 2 weeks prior and they just said sorry.
reviews.title: Great Location - Check-in Early

reviews.text: They did send me the the Hilton on the Bay which is only about a mile away. And they did pay for my stay there, including parking. It sucked having to switch hotels for the night, but they at least paid for it.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Labor Day weekend stay at the SD Hilton Gaslamp Hotel

reviews.text: I came back the next day and they moved me up to a nice suite. The room was nice, the furniture was a little bit warn but overall it was a nice room. The only draw back was that my room then faced the Hard Rock Hotel which was pretty loud. I could open the balcony and listen to music in my room. They were having an outside pool party and it was very loud, but I didn't mind. The hotel was quite when I needed to sleep.
reviews.title: Great location, just don't park there!

aka: Hilton San Diego Gaslamp Quarter Hotel San Diego
description: Stylish 12-story Hotel situated in downtown's historic Gaslamp Quarter, adjacent to the bay.
